title: Jaylen Brown continues to shine as Celtics hold off furious 76ers run, win third straight: 9 takeaways
author: Tom Westerholm
bullets: Jaylen Brown scored 32 points leading the Celtics to a 109-108 victory over the 76ers, their third consecutive win.
The Celtics struggled against a late 76ers comeback but managed a last-second defensive stop to secure the win.
The Celtics and 76ers each had 56 rebounds; Boston led offensive boards 16-9, with strong efforts from González and Minott.

title: Julia Fox defends controversial Jackie O. Halloween costume
author: Morgan Rousseau
bullets: Actress Julia Fox faced backlash for dressing as a bloodied Jackie Kennedy at a Halloween party and online.
Jack Schlossberg, JFK's grandson, condemned Fox's costume on social media, calling it 'disgusting, desperate and dangerous.'
Fox claimed the costume was a statement on trauma and power, referencing Jackie Kennedy's actions after JFK's assassination.

title: Falcons QB Michael Penix Jr., WR Drake London set to play vs. Patriots
author: Kaley Brown
bullets: Falcons QB Michael Penix Jr. and WR Drake London to play vs. Patriots after recovering from injuries.
Penix and London were full participants in practice on Friday, following limited sessions midweek due to prior injuries.
Drake London has caught 38 passes on 63 targets this season, averaging 78.2 yards per game for Atlanta.

title: Craig Breslow believes Red Sox are in ‘improved position’ to get ‘right players’ this offseason
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Red Sox chief baseball officer Craig Breslow aims to improve the team further despite reaching playoffs in 2025.
Key offseason decisions include addressing potential roster holes left by Alex Bregman, Lucas Giolito, and Trevor Story.
Red Sox have financial and prospect resources to reinforce their roster, being $25 million under the luxury tax threshold.

title: Mike Vrabel says recent Patriots changes have nothing to do with wanting to separate from the past
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Mike Vrabel has implemented changes to Patriots' traditions, including individual introductions for offensive starters before games.
Despite adjustments, Vrabel insists changes aren't intended to break from the Patriots' successful past.
The Patriots are currently 6-2 and leading the AFC East under Vrabel's new coaching approach.

title: Bruins’ Elias Lindholm will miss ‘a few weeks’, Khusnutdinov promoted to 1C
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Elias Lindholm to miss several weeks due to a lower-body injury sustained against the Buffalo Sabres.
Marat Khusnutdinov promoted to the Bruins' first line, replacing Lindholm as center alongside Pastrnak and Geekie.
Lindholm contributed four power-play goals, aiding Bruins' 13th-ranked power play before his injury.

title: Photos: The best moments from Salem on Halloween 2025
author: Kelly Chan
bullets: Tourists in costumes filled Salem, Massachusetts, for Halloween 2025, the busiest day for the city.
Salem featured markets, performances, and Halloween decor, with people visiting popular museums and sites.
Essex Street and Salem Common were crowded with costumed visitors enjoying food trucks and photo opportunities.

title: Moulton, without proof, accuses Trump of abusing girls with Epstein in tense TV interview
author: Ross Cristantiello
bullets: Rep. Seth Moulton accused President Trump of abusing girls with Jeffrey Epstein during an MSNBC interview without providing evidence.
Moulton's allegations occurred during a discussion on effective political messaging for upcoming 2026 midterm elections.
Host Joe Scarborough challenged Moulton's accusations due to lack of evidence, emphasizing there are other issues to discuss about Trump.

title: Brian Walshe’s next court appearance scheduled as cellphone evidence remains accessible
author: Beth Treffeisen
bullets: Judge Diane Freniere scheduled Brian Walshe's competency hearing for November 14 and jury selection on November 18.
Evidence from ex-State Police Trooper Michael Proctor's cellphone remains preserved for use in Walshe's trial.
Walshe's defense team argues access to Proctor's phone data could reveal information favorable to their client.

title: Star Market over the Mass. Pike reopens after asbestos scare
author: Beth Treffeisen
bullets: The Star Market above the Massachusetts Turnpike reopened after a three-day closure due to an asbestos scare.
MassDEP confirmed the asbestos was contained to a stockroom and posed no risk after testing air and surfaces.
Asbestos abatement measures will continue in a sealed area of the stockroom, ensuring public safety.
